item.title: Report E-2023060437
item.description:
Report E-2023060437

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XQC experienced a UN1604 Ethylenediamine release from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 6' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. An acid neutralizing absorbent was deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 95-gallon and 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060415
item.description:
Report E-2023060415

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCH experienced a release of UN1230 Methanol DR448 C from a 55-gallon steel drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 20' x 5' area of the concrete lot and trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and boom were deployed to clean and contain the release. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly drum. All cleanup debris was containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023060619
item.description:
Report X-2023060619

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered at Mokena Station 610 on the 200 van line between work areas 216 and 236 by Alpimex BC, Andres Galvez, who immediately informed FedEx Ops Manager, Robert Sanner. During this time, it was discovered that two employees, Darrius Cozart and Jeremy Murray, had come in contact with the hazmat. Robert immediately instructed Darrius and Jeremy to rinse hands under water. Robert then placed damaged hazmat in bag + tote and promptly removed the package from the work area. He then communicated incident to ops admins, Emil Wisch (myself) and Keeli Palmateer. Emil & Keeli instantly moved to location to assess the incident. There was a small amount of the hazmat spilled in drops under the line/rollers between work areas 216 and 236. There were two places where the spill was more concentrated (one was roughly an area of 10" X 2" and the other roughly 14" x 2"). Emil instructed nearby managers, package handlers, BCs and drivers to stay clear of the area and left to retrieve PPE and cleanup materials while Keeli researched first aid response for Darrius and Jeremy. She echoed Robert's instructions of running contact areas under water (adding the details running under COLD water for 15 MINUTES). Darrius and Jeremy were moved to the office where Senior Manager, Nancy Morris and P&D Manager, Patryk Rojewski took over first aid. Emil returned and spread AMPHOMAG neutralizer on spill locations while Keeli observed (training). It was later discovered that the spill had actually originated in a trailer in the unload. It is unknown how the damage to the package occurred. There were no reports of any injuries to any employees who were near that trailer at the time the package was unloaded. Emil and Keeli moved to the location where the spill had originated. Emil spread AMPHOMAG neutralizer on all visible locations of the spilled hazmat while Keeli observed (training). Emil and Keeli later returned to both locations where the neutralizer was spread and collected all materials in hazmat bags and totes. There are no known complications to employees, Darrius Cozart or Jeremy Murray, proceeding the incident up to the time of this report. Both reported to work the following day with no known restrictions. DescribePack: There was a large hole/tear in the outer container of the package. Inside the package were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of hazmat. Each bottle was contained in a plastic bag. One of those bottles' caps was unfastened. No damage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: 1 hour is overestimating. I believe the release was less than 30 minutes (in our facility, station 610). Response was timely and well-coordinated. Mitigation included prompt first-aid to 2 affected employees, near-instant containment of damaged package allowing no future release and neutralization of acid to prevent any further damage to people, package and facility.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 26, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of Zep FS Foaming Liquid was punctured by a nail and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. HCE personnel noted that terminal personnel had deployed neutralizing absorbents and overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. HCE deployed additional absorbents to the spill and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 11, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 150-gallons of product to the loading dock floor, pallets, and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. HCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent and granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The crew hand pumped the remaining product to one (1) new 325-gallon tote. Cres utilized a Sawzall to dismantle the damaged 275-gallon tote. All UN3264 impacted material was containerized into eight (8) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: CTCX 733705 Styrene car was found leaking from the combination housing in the Galesburg Yard. CTCX 733705 was inspected by the Mechanical Hazmat Responder and it was determined the liquid valve 4 bolt flange bolts were less than tool tight. This allowed product to be released. Mechanical tightened the liquid valve four flange bolts to mitigate the release. A BNSF Contractor was dispatched to inspect the car after repairs were made by BNSF Mechanical.

  • City: MOKENA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at top/beginning of 200 line in middle of station spilling contents. Interviewed all known responders and it is unknown how package fell, dropped or was impacted. Package was seen intact and not leaking prior to incident. Manager, Matt Malloy, and QA Admin, Keeli Palmateer minimized release by placing leaking package in hazmat bag and spill tote. Matt Malloy then spread the Amphomag Universal Spill Neutralizer on spilled material. Maintenance assisted in cleanup - all cleanup materials were placed in hazmat bags and totes. DescribePack: The structure of the outer fiberboard box looked to have been broken down. There were also tears (1 x 4 inches and 1 x 2 inches) in the outer fiberboard box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Sealed in drums or double bagged anything that came in contact with the flammable liquid.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS DISCOVERED DURING THE UNLOADING PROCESS WET AND ODOROUS. THE MANEGER THEN DISPATCHED TO QA, ONCE THE QA GOT TO THE UNLOAD DOOR THE BOX WAS IMMEDIATELY REMOVERED FOM THE AREA AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND PLACED UNDER THE VENTILATION SYSTEM. THE SPILL WAS CONTAINED IN THE BOX IT DID NOT LEAK ON THE FLOOR OR IN THE TRAILER THAT IT CAME OUT OF. THERE WERE SPILL PROTECTIVE PADS INSIDE THE BOX. DescribePack: IT APPEARS THAT THE CAP ON THE BOTTLE WAS JUST LOOSE. THERE WAS NO PROTECTIVE SEAL UNDER THE CAP DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE BOX WAS IMMEDIATELY REMOVED FROM THE UNLOAD AREA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE UNDER THE VENTILATION SYSTEM.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWILIGHT RECEIVED A CALL FROM A SUPEVISOR THAT A LEAKING HAZMAT WAS ON THE IR2 BALL MAT. THE RESPONDER LEFT THE PSC TO GO TO THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP TAKING A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. THE RESPONDER HAD ON PPE (NITRILE GLOVES, LATEX GLOVES, SILVER SHIELD LINERS, SLEEVES, APRON, GOGGLES, AND BOOTS). AT THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH A FLAMMABLE LIQUID, 3, LEAKED LIQUID ONTO A CART AND THEN THE RESPONDER TOOK A JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE TO BEGIN CLEAN UP. USED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND SOLIDIFIED THE LIQUID USING CLAY BASED ABSORBENT. THE PACKAGE WAS SEPARATED AND CONTAINERIZED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. DEBRIS WITH THE SOLIDIFED MATERIAL WAS THEN PLACED INSIDE A SEPARATE SPILL TRAY. IT WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP TO GET PROCESSED AND REFERED TO A WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FLOW CHART. DMP PROCEDURES WERE FOLLOWED AND ONE DMP BAG WAS MADE DECON OF PPE.

item.title: Report X-2023050679
item.description:
Report X-2023050679

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SLIC 6039 TWILIGHT HAD A CORROSIVE HAZMAT, TRIFLUROACERIC ACID, LEAK ON A BALL MAT AT WEST BULK. PSC WAS CALLED BY A SUPERVISOR TO SEND A DESIGNATED RESPONDER AT 16:36. RISK OF EMPLOYEE BEING EXPOSED WERE MIDIGATED BY THE SUPERVISOR IN THAT AREA. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPILL FIFTEEN MINUTES LATER WITH A FULLY STOCKED PUSHCART AND SCBA UNIT. THE RESPONDER WORE NITRILE GLOVES, LATEX GLOVES, BOOTS, APRON, GOGGLES, SLEEVES AND SILVER SHIELD LINERS. USED THE JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR CORROSIVE. PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY AND THEN VISIBLE FUMES WERE SEEN COMING OUT OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER BEGAN AT THE BEGINNING OF THE DECISION TREE AND THE CONTAINMENT SHEET FOR ACTIVATION OF THE CHAIN OF COMMAND, PAGE 17. CORDONED OFF THE AREA USING CAUTION TAPE AND NOTIFIED CEC AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVATED THE CHAIN OF COMMAND. OUTSIDE RESPONDER ARRIVED AT 19:15 AND TOOK THE PACKAGE AND DEBRIS RELATED TO THE SPILL. NO DECONTAMINATION OF SCBA OR PPE IT WAS NOT USED TO CLEAN UP.

Report E-2023050381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1442 ET, XPO terminal XQC contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Rock Island, IL. The spill consisted of (1) 4-gallon metal can of UN1263 R-Cure 200 Primer Epoxy, which was dented at the top by a forklift blade, causing approximately 1-cup to release onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they were comfortable to clean up the spill with Oil Dri and PPE, but did not have a waste drum. ERTS will dispatched a contractor to drop off a 55-gallon poly drum. Once it arrived, XPO placed the waste into the drum which was then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023050615
item.description:
Report X-2023050615

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Station 0610 Sort Manager, Kyle Beaumont, discovered the package with soiled exterior. There was no evidence of spillage at station 0610. He immediately placed package into a plastic hazardous materials bag and then into a hazardous materials tub and delivered to QA area for QA inspection. Emil Wisch sealed hazmat and placed in hazmat cage on spill containment pallet. DescribePack: Outer packaging seems to have been undamaged prior to leak from internal container. The uppermost portion of the cap of the internal container (bottle) was broken off, leaving the threaded portion of the body of the cap mostly intact. There was not additional packing material inside the outer package to cushion the internal bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in a hazardous materials bag. The package was handled with care not to further allow additional release. No leakage occurred at this point or beyond.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a loose lid. Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-05T18:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: MARINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 2, 2023, at 1945 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Plainfield, Indiana regarding the release of approximately 35-gallons of VEX244-506 C Vinyl Ester Resin (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a puncture and was contained to an 8’ x 53’ area of the trailer floor as well as a 1' x 1' area of the shoulder of the roadway. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal. E-2023050167 On May 3, 2023, at 1411 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Plainfield, Indiana regarding the release of approximately 5 gallons of VEX244-506 C Vinyl Ester Resin (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a puncture and was contained to an 6’ long trail and continuing on to a 3' x 3' area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 95-gallon metal drum which was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023050483
item.description:
Report E-2023050483

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-20
  • City: ASHKUM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck and tanker load were in route to destination. Driver was making a right turn at an intersection and in the process let the rear trailer tandems on the right side drop off of the pavement. This caused the truck and tanker to roll over onto its right side off of the right side of the road. When the tanker rolled over there was a minor leak of product that was dripping from the washout cap on the tanker. There was an estimated 4 gallons that leaked out and most of the product was captured in a container. There was also a small amount of engine oil and diesel from the truck that leaked out. The police, fire department responded to the scene. An emergency response contractor was also activated to respond to the scene for load transfer and cleanup and remediation. The load was successfully transferred from the damaged tanker to another tanker and transported to the destination facility. The ground was properly cleaned up and remediated.

  • Description: A leak was observed on a van trailer, and it was unloaded to determine the cause. An IBC/tote was observed with a rusted metal enclosure that caused a pin-size hole in the inner polymer bottle. The released material was cleaned with absorbent pads and oil-dry. The material was transferred into a new IBC/tote, and re-weighed. It was determined that the released material was below the applicable RQ.

  • City: MELROSE PARK

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 27, 2023, four (4) one-half (0.5) gallon containers of Rust Go (UN1790) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed soda ash to neutralize the acid and swept them in with hand tools, later using a degreaser and absorbent pads to remove any residual product. All UN1790 impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On April 27, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing printing ink (UN1210) was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surface. HCE personnel utilized granular absorbents and swept them in with hand tools to remediate the release. The crew then collected and containerized all ink impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. HCE overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On March 22nd we were advised of a Air Export shipment being arranged from Sterling Pharma. We were provided the attached photo clearly showing the Class 9 UN3077 Labels. It appears that Sterling Pharma covered up the package in brown paper and sent the package to OutpostSVC/Innexus in Houston, TX via Fedex Ground. See attached photo There was then some confusion as to if this was the same shipment and it was unknown if the shipment was DG so Intelligent SCM DG Air export operator had the package sent to our DG packer in the Chicago area (RAS) to ensure that this shipment was properly packaged with the correct DGD.

  • Description: On April 7, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing NA1760 was damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HES personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack as hazardous waste. The crew then utilized varying absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all NA1760 impacted material in one (1) 55-gallond drum for disposal.

  • Description: A BELT TENDER ON PD2 SHUT OFF THE BELT AND REMOVED THE LEAKING PACKAGE. A RESPONDER WAS THEN CALLED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER HAD A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND WAS SEEN WEARING PPE. GOGGLES, GLOVES (NITRILE, CHEMICAL NITRILE, SILVER SHIELD LINERS), SLEEVES, AND APRON. THE RESPONDER USED THE JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. THE PH OF THE LIQUID WAS 13 FOUND USING PH INDICATOR TAPE AND SODIUM BICARBONATE WAS USED TO MAKE NEUTRAL. THE PACKAGE WITH CONTAINERS WAS PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY AND BROUGHT BACK FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023040815
item.description:
Report X-2023040815

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-21
  • City: AURORA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 21st DG Admin was called about a leaking package that appeared to be undeclared. There were no markings on the outside of the package that indicated and hazardous materials were inside. DG Admin instructed the station to open the package and there was a 1 gallon can of PPG PSX 700 that was dented and had the top pop off and the contents leaked out. DG Admin found a Safety Data Sheet for the same product by the same manufacturer that states it is UN3066 Paint, 8, PGIII. The other small cans in the package had no label. DG Admin advised the station to place the package in a salvage drum and await further disposition.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSW experienced a release of UN1824 "Select NonAcid Wheel & Tire Cleaner VOC" from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the concrete dock floor and woof pallet due to a pallet nail puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail and all cleanup debris were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023040286

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-14
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Roadrunner Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 14, 2023, at 0759 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of approximately 10 gallons of Nalco 7330 (Corrosive liquid, acidic, organic, n.o.s., 5-Chloro-2-Methyl-4-Isothiazolin-3-one, UN3265, 8, II) from (2) 55-gallon drums. The release was contained to an 8’ x 15’ area of the trailer floor and was reportedly due to a forklift puncture. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drums were containerized in (2) 95-gallon poly drums. All other waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:

  • City: BEDFORD PARK

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART AND DECISION TREE IN HAND, RESPONDER WAS CALLED UNLOAD BAY 15. RESPONDER NOTICED A SPILL ON THE GRATING WITH CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD. RESPONDER WORKED THROUGH THE DECSION TREE AND THIS LED TO CONTAINERIZE THE LIQUID AND BRING TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER. TESTED THE P.H OF THE PRODUCT AND IT WAS NOT WITHIN THE NEUTRAL RANGE. RESPONDER USED SODIUM BICARBONATE TO CONTAINERIZE AND NEUTRAL P.H. THEN PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE SPILL TRY NOTICED ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP. RETURNED DAMAGE TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR PROPER WASTE DISPOSAL AND DECONTAMINATION.

HEC personnel deconstructed the pallet and removed the pails. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all paint thinner impacted material in four (4) 55-gallon drums.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART AND DECISION TREE IN HAND RESPONDER WAS CALLED UNLOAD BAY 159. RESPONDER NOTICED SPILL ON THE GRATING WITH CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD. RESPONDER WORKED THROUGH THE DECSION TREE AND THIS LED TO CONTAINERIZE THE LIQUID AND BRING IT BACK TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER. TESTED THE P.H OF THE PRODUCT AND IT WAS NOT WITHIN THE NEUTRAL RANGE. USED SODIUM BICARBONATE TO CONTAINERIZE AND NEUTRAL P.H. AS RESPONDER PLACED THE BUCKET IN THE SPILL TRY NOTICED A LARGE PUNCTURE ON THE SIDE CORNER. SEEMED LIKE IT GOT CAUGHT ON THE BAY DOOR OR A HANGING BOLT AS IT WAS BEING TRANSPORTED TO THE BULK SIDE. ONCE CONTAINERIZED RESPONDER RETURNED DAMAGE TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR PROPER WASTE DISPOSAL AND DECONTAMINATION.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On March 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of alkaline foam cleaner (UN3098) was punctured by a nail and released approximately sixteen (16) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Response Management Services (RMS) to remediate the impacted surface. RMS personnel placed a drum under the damaged drum to catch any spillage, then overpacked both drums in two (2) 95-gallon drums. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all UN3098 impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE DISCOVERED ON A CONVEYOR AND THERE WAS LIQUID COMING OUT OF IT. THE PACKAGE THAT LEAKED WAS ON PD3 SINGULATOR STOPPING THE BELT UNTIL A DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS DISPATCED TO THE SPILL LOCATION BY A SUPERVISOR. AT 21:30 A RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND WEARING FULL PPE, (APRON, GLOVES X 3 AND SILVER SHIELD CHEMICAL LINERS, GOGGLES, BOOTS, AND SLEEVES). THE RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND THE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE PROPER LABELING TO INDICATE THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT. THE REPSONDER USED THE REPSONSE SHEET FOR NO LABEL ON BOX OR UNKNOWN. PH INDICTOR TAPE WAS USED TO FIND THE PH PF THE LIQUID, PH OF 14. NEXT THE CORROSIVE SHEET WAS USED AND SODIUM BICARBONATE WAS ADDED IN SMALL AMOUNTS TO MAKE THE SUBSTANCE NEUTRAL. THE FINAL PH READING WAS 9 AND THE NEUTRAL LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFED WITH ZEP ZORBENT. THE PACKAGE AND DEBRIS WAS TAKEN TO THE PSC.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-17
  • City: EFFINGHAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/17/2023 at approximately 0835, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 346917 at a station location in Effingham, reporting an undeclared aerosol shipment. The shipment consists of 2 fiberboard boxes, each contained aerosol cans. The shipment ending in -6972 contained 48 cans and the shipment ending in -6983 contained 12 cans. Shipment -6972 was discovered by the distinct aerosol rattling as it was moved. Being a part of a 2- piece mutilple shipment, the agents searched for the second box and discovered shipment -6983, also with the distinct rattling sound. Additionally, shipment -6983 was also labeled "12 AEROSOL CANS" on one side and "CONTENTS IN AEROSOL CANS" on an adjacent side. These packages were not marked and labeled in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipments are being held pending and IATA investigation.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FROM AN INBOUND SUPERVISOR WHEN A PLASTIC CONTAINER OF FLAMMABLE LIQUID. THE RMP SENT A DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO CLEAN UP THE LEAKER. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE (GLOVES X 3 AND SILVER SHIELD LINER, BOOTS, GOGGLES, AND APRON). THE RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID COMING FROM THE CONTAINER WAS NOT SOLIDIFIED, AND THE COTAINER WAS PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. IT WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP. ONE BAG WAS MADE OF THE CONTAINER OF LIQUID WITH CLAY ABSORBENT LINING THE BOTTOM AS A BARRIER. BAG AND TAG WAS DONE AND RECORDED IN THE DISPOSAL LOG. DECONTAMINATION WAS PERFORMED ON THE PPE WORN DURING AND AFTER THE SPILL CLEAN UP.

item.title: Report X-2023030908
item.description:
Report X-2023030908

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-16
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A LEAKING PACKAGE WAS DISCHARGED FROM PD5 CONVEYOR BELT TO BAY 308 AND WAS FOUND BY THE LOADER. THE LOADER DID NOT TOUCH THE PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR IMMEDIATELY AND CALLED A DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO CLEAN IT UP. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE (APRON, GOGGLES, BOOTS, GLOVES X 3 AND SILVER SHIELD LINER, AND SLEEVES). THE RESPONDER TOOK A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART TO THAT LOCATION SOON AFTER. THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE GRATING AND HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY LABEL ON IT. THE RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND LIMITED QUANTITY RESPONSE SHEET. THE LIQUID WAS PH TESTED USING PH INDICATOR TAPE BUT DID NOT REGISTER. THEN THE RESPONDER USED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. THE LIQUID WAS NOT CONTAMINATED THE CARDBOARD AND DID NOT NEED TO BE SOLIDIFED. IT WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED COMPLETELY TRHOUGH THE DMP AND ONE BAG WAS MADE. DECON OF PPE WAS FOLLOWED USING CHECKLIST.

item.title: Report X-2023030895

Report X-2023030895

  • City: ADDISON

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: HAZMAT LEAKING AND WAS CALLED IN TO THE PSC BY AN OUTBOUND SUPERVISOR. ONCE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED, THEY LEFT TO GO TO THE SPILL WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. THE RESPONDER WORE FULL PPE (APRON, GOGGLES, BOOTS, GLOVES X 3 WITH CHEMICAL SILVER SHEILD LINER, AND SLEEVES). THE RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISON TREE, AND THE LEAKING PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DOT DIAMOND AND SHIPPING PAPERS. THE RESPONDER USED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET FOR RESPONSE ACTION STEPS AND CLEANED UP OF THE PACKAGE. A SMALL AMOUNT OF CLAY BASED ABSORBENT WAS USED TO SOLIDIFY THE LIQUID AND IT WAS PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FLOW CHART. DMP PROCEDURES WERE FOLLOWED FOR PROPER DISPOSTION OF THE PACKAGE.

A RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL WEARING FULL PPE (GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, GLOVES AND SILVER SHIELD INNER LINER, AND SLEEVES). THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE WAS LABELED WITH THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID DOT DIAMOND. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISON TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS. THEN BY FOLLOWING THE RESPONSE STEPS, THE RESPONDER ADDED CLAY BASED ABSORBENT TO THE LIQUID USED TO SOLIDIFY THE LIQUID COMPLETELY. THEN IT WAS SWEPT UP WITH BROOM AND PLASTIC DUSTPAN AND PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY WITH THE PAKCAGE. MATERIALS WERE BROGUHT TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023030417
item.description:
Report E-2023030417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-16
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: LUFTHANSA CARGO AKTIENGESELLSCHAFT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: There were 2 canisters of Bovine Semen each banded on their own plastic skid. They were loaded on a maindeck pallet up on the high side of the contour by FRA. Our warehouse agent working Import breakdown, came up to the pallet and began to forklift one of the pieces from the pallet (they weigh around 70 plus kgs each). When he was backing up the forklift bounced a little from the motion of moving from the roller-mat area to the warehouse floor and the piece fell over to the side and on the ground because of the flimsy skid it was on. He immediately notified the Supervisor and the area was cordoned off and the fire department was contacted. After the fire department assessed the situation they said it was ok for us to call our Haz clean up team who came in put the package into a recover drum without a lid on top.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Properly clearing any liquid stains on the metal jerrican using absorbent pads and new plastic bags with absorbent pads inside to avoid anymore leaking.

DescribePack: The closure broke open from the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package Handler was taken out of the area and checked up on for any injuries and spills.   • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: DURING REWRAP OF TWO PACKAGES FROM HUNGARY TO THE USA WE DISCOVERED SEVEN INNER BOXES INSIDE UNMARKED BOXES. THE INNER BOXES WERE MARKED AS LIMITED QUANTITY. INSPECTED CONTENTS OF THOSE INNER BOXES AND FOUND TEN INNER PRODUCT BOXES CONTAINING TWO PACKETS OF NESPRESSO DESCALING AGENT. EACH PACKET CONTAINED 2 X 100 ML. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED FROM HUNGARY. LTD QTY WAS ON THE INNER BOXES ONLY. PACKAGES ALSO CONTAIN UNREGULATED NESPRESSO AEROCCINO PLASTIC CAPS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER GOING TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE 1Z8V83V40416675934.

  • Description: On March 02, 2023, two (2) one-gallon pails of MM-80 Part (A) (UN2735) were damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hazchem Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. HES personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to containerize all MM-80 Part (A)-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023020494
item.description:
Report E-2023020494

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-24
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XCH reported a 55-gallon spill of UN2735 "ANCAMINE K54" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by a broken pallet and impacting their trailer floor as well as the asphalt near dock door 169. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 55-gallons of product released to an 8' x 24' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 15' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and neutralizer were collected into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: During the unloading process at the Chicago terminal the dockworker was attempting to enter the skid with the forklift and punctured a 55-gallon steel drum on the pallet. It was discovered that the drum broke through the pallet in transit. The container was immediately turned on its side to prevent further release of material. The released material was cleaned up with absorbent material and placed in an overpack for appropriate disposal. We were unable to safely obtain the identification markings on the drum due to the material being hazardous.

item.title: Report X-2023020883
item.description:
Report X-2023020883

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-11
  • City: NILES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 6 PM, I ran a report in Business objects looking for damages under Axalta's shipper number. One package appeared and I saw that it was currently in trailer 828334 on door 213 at our location. I checked SPIDR and package did appear to have leakage visible, along with being undeclared. I alerted management and because an odor could be smelled coming from the trailer, upper management and safety specialists were contacted and the decision was made to call a spill team. Per directions from the safety specialist, the trailer was taken off door 213 and put in the yard with the door open to allow it to air out. Total number of packages in the trailer was 531. I checked all packages scanned into the trailer and saw there was one flammable gas package (UN1057). 4-person spill team from Hazchem Environmental arrived at around 10:30 PM. The trailer was moved to door 9 and the hazmat team parked their truck on door 10. Trailer was opened, hazmat team suited up in level C PPE and tested air, no alert. They unloaded the trailer with no air quality alerts until the rear. There was a strong odor. Package was discovered in the belly of the trailer. Spill team opened box and confirmed leakage. There were two bottles inside and both were leaking. DescribePack: Both bottles were leaking. The bottles were each inside a bag and both bags had free liquid. The bottles were placed in a larger non-hazmat bag that was not secured shut. There was some evidence of dried leakage on box. DurationRel: 192 and MitigateEffect: HAZCHEM Spill team placed the package in a white salvage drum with DOT hazard labels and hazardous waste label. Drum and box were removed by HAZCHEM for disposal. HAZCHEM said the trailer was not contaminated. Trailer was closed and left on door 9 in the unload with around half of the packages still inside. HAZCHEM departed with the package at around 11:55 PM 2/12/23. Spoke to team manager and he estimated cost of response as around 4,200 dollars, and around 250 for disposal of the package. The cost of the incident is just an estimate. I have pictures of the box and contents if needed.

  • Description: On February 21, 2023, ERTS was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of Masonry Restorer (Corrosive liquid, toxic, n.o.s., UN2922, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic jug, reportedly due to a forklift puncture. The release was contained to a 2’ x 7’ area of the trailer floor. No soil, drains or waterways were reportedly impacted by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. The damaged container, used absorbents and all other waste generated from the response were containerized in (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The waste drum was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023020165
item.description:
Report E-2023020165

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-05
  • City: INA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was doing a load check when a drip was noticed coming from the bottom of the trailer. Driver placed an absorbent pad under the drip, and contacted Clean Harbors emergency operations center. The EOC deployed a spill response team, to the driver's location to asses the situation. The spill response team monitored the air quality in the trailer and determined it was safe to enter. The team put on the proper PPE, and began to remove the drums frim the trailer. The leaking drum was located, and inspected. A pin hole leak was found on the bottom of the drum. There was no other evidence of damage. The floor of the trailer was wet, and the team estimated that 10 gallons of material had been released. The majority of the 10 gallons was contained in the back of the trailer, with less than a gallon leaking out onto the ground. The leaking drum was placed into and appropriate salvage drum and the spill was cleaned up with absorbents. The spill clean up material and PPE was placed into a proper container. The salvage drum and the rest of the load were secured, and placed back into the trailer to be shipped to the disposal facility.

Terminal personnel cleaned up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (1) 85-gallon metal drum to be properly disposed of by terminal personnel.

Flight Attendants notified the captain and placed the device in the fire containment bag and placed the bag in an empty cart per procedure as a precaution and monitored the bag with no further incidence.

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-31
  • City: CAHOKIA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated that he pulled into Phillips rack and connected his truck by customer policy. he knew from experience that arm 2 on bay 4 leaks and was shown how to stop the leak while the product was loading. The arm began to drip and the driver adjusted the arm and returned to the doghouse to finish the load. The arm began to leak again so the driver put a bucket under the arm and adjusted it again. After loading the driver wiped the spill up with absorbent pads and notified the driver behind him. Driver failed to notify Phillips personnel of the spill. Driver did not notify Groendyke Safety until he returned to the rack to load again and was locked out.

item.title: Report E-2023020506
item.description:
Report E-2023020506

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-29
  • City: JOLIET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Schneider Bulk Carriers
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 29, 2023, Schneider Bulk notified ERTS of a cargo release from trailer #24633 involving UN 3264 Envirocid Plus due to a faulty internal valve. No drains or waterways were impacted. HazChem was dispatched to assess and perform the cleanup needed. The crew arrived on site and found the trailer with a slight drip coming from the unloading valves. Before the contractor arrived, the driver placed a 2-gallon pail underneath to catch the drips. When HazChem was checking the valves if they were loose found that one was cracked causing the slow release. Schneider was able to fix the pipe that was cracked no transfer truck will be necessary. There was no impact to the concrete found, the crew generated one drum of impacted absorbents that was transported to Tradebe in Milwaukee, WI for proper disposal. All on-site work was completed on January 29, 2023.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking near door 2 of the RORS unload. OPS Manager Patrick Barajas said it was loaded at the top of the trailer and when he opened it to unload, it came falling down, puncturing the bottom. Package was then flipped on its side to avoid leakage before it was taken out of the unload and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: Package had a very small puncture wound at its bottom, allowing for hazardous liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the Hazmat cage for isolation and processing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and open after it had just gone down chute 69 in Load 6 of RORS 622. This caused a spill inside and also outside the trailer. Package was not labeled as a Hazmat in any way but was determined to be 6 bottles of bleach. All bleach is considered Hazardous materials. The spill was immediately cleaned up and the package was isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 2 bottles of the bleach inside the box had their caps off, along with their seals torn. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the Hazmat cage for isolation and processing.

UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT PRODUCTS. THE BOX IS PREPRINTED WITH PERISHABLE AND KEEP REFRIGERATED OR FROZEN BUT NO INDICATION THAT DRY ICE IS COOLING THE PRODUCTS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT 047168, HAPPY TO MEAT YOU, LLC/ QVC INC, 7128 W GRAND AVE, CHICAGO IL 60707. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGES INDICATING DRY ICE IS BEING USED. THE INNER CARTON FLAP INSIDE THE BOXES ARE PREPRINTED AS CAUTION-PACKAGE MAY CONTAIN DRY ICE. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: On January 19, 2023, one (1) 250-gallon tote containing UN3265 was damaged in transit and released one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surface. EWI personnel transferred the contents of the damaged tote into one (1) 330-gallon tote. The crew utilzed absorbents and hand tools to collect the spill and containerized all UN3265-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: XPO Logistics XQC called in to report a .25-gallon spill of UN1789 "Hercules Sizzle" from a 1-gallon plastic pail caused by improper loading that impacted their trailer and dock. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading;the jug was punctured by adjacent freight. Absorbents were deployed and EcoSorb was then used to neutralize the impacted area. The impacted cardboard, damaged jug, and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 11, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing hydrogen peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental Services (HES) to perform the necessary remedial actions. The crew started by placing the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon over-pack. HES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the surface, then placed all hydrogen peroxide-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Outbound sort put the bagged package in a repack tote to prevent further leaks.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site.   • Description: On January 4, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1993 arrived with a faulty seal and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to perform the necessary remedial actions. HCE personnel containerized the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface. All UN1993-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. Both waste drums were staged for disposal by R+L.

Package was immediately taken and isolated from the staff. DescribePack: One of the two bottles of bleach had a loose faulty cap that was leaked out of the side of it. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat cage for isolation and processing.

  • Description: Truck driver reached for a drink on the passenger seat and went off the roadway. the driver then over-corrected back onto the roadway and flipped the truck on its side. The truck slid on its side before coming to a rest on the roadway. The valves in various locations were damaged during the crash which led to the propane leak. The propane was venting for approximately 2 hours. Fire, EMS, and law enforcement were immediately dispatched to the scene. Fire Department mitigated the fire with water for approximately 3 hrs.

  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT SPILL WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. RESPONDER HAD YELLOW SLEAVES, RUBER BOOTS, GLOVES, SILVER LINER, RUBBER GLOVES, APRON, AND GOOGLES. USED REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND RESPONS SHEETS. THE DECISION TREE LED RESPONDER TO THE FLAMABLE LIQUIDS RESPONS SHEET. THEN SOLIDIFIED THE SPILLED LIQUID WITH ZEP ZORBENT AND SWEPT IT UP WITH A FIBER BROOM AND PLASTIC DUSTPAN. RESPONDER PLACED THE ABSORBED MATERIAL INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK TO PSC AND REFFERED TO WASTE DISPOSAL SHEET FOR A FULL DMP FACILITY.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: At some point the package began leaking while driver was transporting package on route. It is unknown what caused the damage. Driver retrieved a salvage drum (unknown source) to contain spill. The salvage drum had the correct Corrosive 8 labeling on it to match the contents. Action taken: intake by QA and placed salvage drum in Hazardous Materials processing area/cage. QA inspected and processed damage report following day (12/21/2022). DescribePack: The only damage observed was leakage. All leakage seems to have occurred in the top-most area of package. Closures were open due to leakage. There were no vents or seals on inner packaging. Closures on bottom of package were still intact. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Driver was able to place package in a bag and salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2022120876
item.description:
Report X-2022120876

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-12
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found emitting a foul/powerful smell and was called for on the radio for QA assistance. Package at first was just emitting a smell and seemed a little wet, but we weren't completely sure. Upon opening the package however, it was evident that the chemical inside was mildly leaking and the inner packaging (a plastic bag holding the contents) was loose, allowing for vapors and some liquid to leak out. DescribePack: Items were in two, small, unlabeled plastic bottles that were very small, probably about 16 ounces each, those were put inside a plastic bag and zip tied. These caps were mildly loose, and the bag zip tie was also loose, allowing for the vapors and liquid to come out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the Hazmat cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report E-2022120309
item.description:
Report E-2022120309

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-05
  • City: MUNDELEIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO requested a team to respond to a 10 gallon spill of UN3266 Coral Eco-Clene from a 55 gallon poly drum. due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to the dock floor in a 3' x 8' area, trailer floor in a 1' x 10' area, and to the asphalt lot below in a 3' x 15’ area due to a puncture. The damaged drum was collected into a 95-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into an 85-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120296
item.description:
Report E-2022120296

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-06
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal XLA reported a release of an estimated 10 gallons or less of "Caramel Liquid Coloring" (UN1197) from a 275-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to the trailer floor in 2' x 2' area due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: TRHU 374554 was reported leaking in the Joliet, IL rail yard on 11/30/2022. BNSF Contractor was dispatched and verified TRHU 374554 was leaking and they unloaded the container. The BNSF Contractor found one 55 Gallon drum punctured and it released approximately 25 gallons of resin solution in the trailer. The leaking drum was properly secured and the trailer was cleaned for further shipment.

item.title: Report E-2022120513
item.description:
Report E-2022120513

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-14
  • City: FRANKLIN PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HGTU 241486 was found to have a small leak from the bottom outlet valve during yard inspection at the CP Bensenville Intermodal Yard on 11-14-22. A qualified ER Contractor was dispatched to the site, and air monitoring equipment was used to establish that no elevated levels of pyridine were found in the area. The Contractor subsequently found that the bottom discharge valve cap was loose and the internal valve gasket surrounding the front flange was peeling, allowing for product to slowly drip out of the flange. Gore PTFE gasket tape was used to make new gaskets, and the leak was stopped. Spilled material was cleaned up, and placed into a drum for disposal.

  • City: BRIDGEVIEW
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XBV called in to report a 100-gallon spill of UN1197 Vanilla Extract from 2 55-gallon poly drums caused by a forklift puncture and impacting their dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released from two 55-gallon poly drums to the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The drums were cut up and containerized. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. All waste was containerized into three 55-gallon and one 85-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0614 ET, XPO Logistics terminal XLA contacted ERTS to report a spill in La Salle, IL. It was advised that a cap was loose on a 260-gallon poly tote of UN3082, and leaked 4 ounces on top of the tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to inspect the tote and conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the tote lid due to a loose cap. The cap was secured, and the material was wiped off the impacted surface. The waste was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum which was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110500
item.description:
Report E-2022110500

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-14
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSW notified ERTS of strong fumes coming from a trailer, with a shipment of UN2363 Ethyl Mercaptan Class 3 PG I on the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to assess the trailer. Contractors arrived onsite and allowed the trailer to air out, then made entry into the trailer. They used a 5 gas meter and reported no readings for LEL. O2 was in a good level as well. Crew found 3 large tanks containing UN2363 Ethyl Mercaptan but had no signs of a leak. The cylinders were separated in the parking lot outside. Contractors conducted a soap test, but it did not produce any results of leaks. A 5 gas was placed close to the valve of one of the tanks and a 1.3ppm reading of H2S was recorded. Crew recommend that the trailer be left open over night to air out and that the tanks be left outside to off gas. A final reading on the tanks was taken and the H2S was down to 0.6ppm. The tanks were coned off and terminal personnel directed to stay clear of the area. No waste was generated. Tanks left onsite for consignee pick-up.

  • Description: While in storage at Schiller Park IMS, awaiting loading onto an OTR trailer, SIMU 250856-4 was dropped from a top-lift unit. SIMU 250856-4 was dropped approximately 5 feet, making impact with another container, SIMU 255349-1, of the same shipment. Impact damaged the shell of SIMU 250856-4, causing approximately 4 gallons to be released. SIMU 255349-1 sustained damage to the outer frame. Both Iso-Tanks were transferred into similar receiving iso-tanks and were cleaned for further assessment and potential repair/scrapping.

  • City: ROMEOVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2022110381 SequenceEvent: Area Manager alerted QA to a hazardous spill in Load Area. Package was placed in a red bin lined with a large hazmat bag. Large spill was found on floor at one end of the IC rollers closest to the door. Absorbent pads were used to clean up the corrosive liquid and were placed in a separate bin with its own hazmat bag. DescribePack: The molding line of the plastic under the handle of the jug has split apart creating a four inch long crack. The majority of the liquid had leaked out onto the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were used to soak up the entire spill and put in a separate bin. 2. X-2022110387 SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking upon arrival to this facility. Package was then immediately taken out of the unload and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose cap that was bent sideways. This allowed for the leakage to occur. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the Hazmat cage for isolation and processing.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XLA called in to report a spill of an unknown amount of UN3261 "DaaFit Plus 910740" from multiple plastic bags caused by improper loading and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 0955 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20 pounds of product released to a 7' x 7' area of the trailer floor from four damaged poly bags. The damaged bags were collected along with all released material and cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2022110045

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-26
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A SPILLED PACKAGE LOCATE IN THE PRIMARY. A SUPERVISOR OF THE UNLOAD CALLED THE PSC BECAUSE MANY IDENTICAL PACKAGES CONTAINING LIQUID WERE GIVING OFF A STRONG SMELL. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER BROUGHT A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART WITH SUPPLIES AND WAS WEARING THE APPROPRIARE PPE. PPE (GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, GLOVES X 3, AND SLEEVES) INDICATED ON THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR CLEAN UP. RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISON TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR LIMITED QUANTITY. A PH TEST WAS TOOK FROM THE LIQUID OF A CONTAINER AND DID NOT REGISTER. RESPONDER WENT TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND SOLIDIFIED USING CLAY BASED ABSORBENT. PACKAGE WAS BROGUHT BACK ONCE THE AREA WAS SWEPT FREE OF DEBRIS. THE PACKAGE WAS IMMEDIATELY PROCESSED USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FLOW CHART. THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST WAS UTILIZED FOR PPE TO GET REUSED.

item.title: Report X-2022101123
item.description:
Report X-2022101123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-17
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE BOX HAVING A VOICE ACTIVATED COUNT DOWN THAT BEGAN AN AUDIBLE COUNT-DOWN DURING A SIX-SIDED CHECK. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ELEVEN DEFIBTECH LIFE-LINE AED UNITS WITH ELEVEN LOOSE 9V BATTERIES PACKED AT THE VERY BOTTOM OF THE BOX UNDER THE AED DEVICES. TEN BATTERIES ARE LITHIUM METAL COMPOSITION. ONE BATTERY IS ALKALINE COMPOSITION. THE BATTERIES ARE NOT PACKAGED IN ANY WAY TO PREVENT SHORT CIRCUIT OR MOVEMENT DURING TRANSPORTATION. THE AED DEVICES ARE PACKAGED ONE ON TOP OF ANOTHER. NOT PROTECTED FROM ACTIVATION DURING TRANSPORTATION. NO INNER PACKAGING FOUND INSIDE THE BOX.

  • Description: A CALL FOR A LEAKER CAME IN FOR RESPONDER TO A SPILL. RESPONDER WEARING FULL P.P.E. AND WITH HIS SPILL CART AND RESPONSE SHEET. UPON ARIVING AT THE SPILL RESPONDER FOUND THE LEAKING BOX WITH TWO DIAMOND HAZMAT STICKERS FOR AN OXIDIZER, AND CORROSIVE. RESPONDER USED THEIR DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR AN OXIDIZER AS IT WAS THE PRIMARY CATEGORY. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND RETURNED FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. BEGAN THE DMP PROCESS FOR THE HAZMAT FOLLOWING THE DMP FLOW CHART.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal XLA reported a release of an unknown amount of "Coagulant 150 RM" (UN2920) from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched HazChem to conduct cleanup operations. At 1053 ET, HazChem personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 gallons of product released to a 4' x 8' area of the trailer floor from two 55-gallon drums. Each drum was placed into an 85 gallon poly and metal drums. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected into a 55 gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On October 6, 2022, two (2) 55-pound boxes containing Maleic Anhydride shifted during transit and released approximately one hundred (100) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Management Alternatives (EMA) to perform the necessary corrective actions. EMA personnel utilized hand tools to collect all released product, then containerized all Maleic Anhydride-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 16, 2022, at 0400 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal XCH reported UN1133 "Sarnacol®-2170 Membrane Adhesive" released 2-quarts from a 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel and determined that terminal personnel was capable of cleaning the spill with proper PPE and ventilation. Terminal personnel placed (1) 5-gallon metal pail and clean up debris into (1) 10-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022100366
item.description:
Report E-2022100366

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-16
  • City: BENSENVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: EXPEDITORS INTERNATIONAL OF WASHINGTON, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipper (Micronova) sent the goods to Expeditors facility in Chicago for consolidation with other shipments destined for the same destination and consignee on 9/7/2022. The freight was not marked or labeled and there was no indication that the goods were DG based on any of the documentation provided by the shipper. On 9/14/2022 the goods were consolidated with the other shipments received and readied for transport. On 9/15/2022 the shipment was confirmed on board the flight under MAWB 172-56923252. On 9/15/2022, Expeditors randomly pulled this file for a compliance review. Expeditors compliance personnel asked operations to confirm with the shipper whether this shipment was DG or not due to the invoice description of some of the items. On 9/16/2022 the shipper confirmed that the shipment was ID8000 Consumer Commodity moving under PI Y963. Unfortunately at this point the freight was already at the final destination.

item.title: Report E-2022100016
item.description:
Report E-2022100016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-02
  • City: TROY
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 02, 2022, Landstar contacted ERTS of a cargo release involving Clothianidin, UN3077 impacting the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a remediation contractor to address the reported UN3077 spill from supersack(s) on Trailer 696404. Following contractor arrival and assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined that the supersacks of concern were not damaged, but rather the tension strings on top of the supersacks were loose, which allowed the product to spill out. The contractor estimated that up to 4-cups of product spilled and affected trailer flooring components only. Product spilled was subsequently collected along with media applied to address affected trailer flooring components. Waste generated is currently pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022091402
item.description:
Report X-2022091402

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-22
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE CALLED INTO THE PSC. THE PSC WAS THEN NOTIFIED AND A DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS SENT IMMEDIATELY FOR CLEAN UP. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER HAD ON FULL PPE AND LEFT THE PSC WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AT THE SPILL THE PH OF THE LIQUID WAS TESTED, PH LESS THAN 1. WENT TO THE CORROSIVE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET ADDING SODIUM BICARBONATE UNTIL THE SUBSTANCE WAS NEUTRAL. ONCE NEUTRAL THE RESPONDER SOLIDIFIED THE MATERIAL USING ZEP, AND THEN DECONTAMINATED THE AREA. THE PACKAGE WITH THE MATERIALS WERE BROUGHT BACK IN TWO LINED SPILL TRAYS. THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FLOW CHART WAS USED TO BEGIN THE PROCESS OF THE DAMAGED LEAKER. DMP PROCEDURES FOLLOWED AND IT WAS PROCESSED, AND PPE WAS DECONTAMINATED AGAIN.

  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: THERE WAS A LEAKING PACKAGE THAT WAS DISCOVERED AT SMALL SORT. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AT SMALL SORT IMMEDIATELY. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS WEARING FULL PPE, AND USED A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. THE INITIAL CLEAN UP BEGAN WITH THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISON TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. ADDED ZEP ZORBENT TO SOLIDIFY AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE PSC. IT WAS LATER PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FACILITY FLOW CHART.

  • Description: On September 8, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methyl acetate was damaged and released approximately .5 gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. HCE personnel overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack, then deployed absorbents and collected all waste into one (1) 55-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2022090401
item.description:
Report E-2022090401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-01
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal XSW reported a release of 0.5 gallons of UN3265 "RainKote NC" from a 330 gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1006 ET, EnviroServe arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 gallons of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to what appears to be a pallet nail puncture. Prior to arrival the released product appeared to have either been absorbed into the trailer or evaporated. The product was transferred out of the damaged tote and into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022090278
item.description:
Report X-2022090278

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-09
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A PACKAGE CAR DRIVER BROUGHT A PACKAGE TO THE PSC TO BE PROCESSED. THE PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT AND THE SUPERVISOR FOLLOWED DESIGNATED RESPONDER TRAINING TO GRAB THE PACKAGE. THE SUPERVISOR WORE FULL PPE BEFORE TOUCHING THE PACKAGE TO LIMIT EXPOSURE. THE PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT, AND SO THE SUPERVISOR USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATED RESPONSE SHEET FOR THE CLEAN UP. PH TESTED THE LIQUID AND GOT A 2, AND THEN ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE. RETESTED THE SUBSTANCE UNTIL NEUTRAL, AND SOLIDIFIED USING ZEP ZORBENT. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN BROUGHT TO THE PSC AND DIPOSED OF USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FACILITY FLOW CHART. THE PPE THAT WAS USED TO CLEAN UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST.

Report X-2022090215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-07
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: THE PSC WAS NOTIFIED AND SENT A DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO GO TO THE HAZMAT SPILL WEARING FULL PPE. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER HAD A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART, AND ARRIVED ASAP. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2021 DECISON TREE AND APPROPRIATED RESPONSE SHEET. THE LEAKING HAZMAT WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID AS SHOWN ON THE OUTER PACKCAGE LABELS. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER USED ZEP ZORBENT TO SOLIDIY THE LIQUID AND DURING THE RESPONSE ACTION STEPS FOLLOWED THE LIQUID SECTION. DECONTAMINATION WAS FOLLOWED PER THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS. THE PACKAGE AND MATERIALS WERE CONTAINERIZED AND PLACED IN LINED SPILL TRAYS TO BE BROUGHT TO THE PSC. THE SPILL LOCTAION WAS CLEANUP FOLLOWING DECONTAMINATION PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2022090194
item.description:
Report X-2022090194

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-06
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PSC WAS CALLED OF A LEAKING PACKAGE AT THE PD2 LOADING DOCK. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPILL WITH FULL PPE (GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON AND GLOVES USING SILVER SHIELD INNER LINER, AND SLEEVES) AND A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UPON ARRIVING TO THE PACKAGE SPILL IT WAS DISCOVERED ON THE METAL GRATING OF THE LOADING DOCK, THE PACKAGE WAS ON ITS SIDE AND APPEARED WET FROM INSIDE. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE PACKAGE USING THE REVISED 2021 DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE STEPS ON PAGE 6, LIMITED QUANTITY. PH TESTED THE LIQUID, PH 6. CHANGED RESPONSE SHEET FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS ON PAGE 7. USED THE ZEP ZORBENT TO SOLIDIFY THE SUBSTANCE AND SWEPT THE REMAINDER OF DEBRIS IN THE AREA THOROUGHLY. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPIL TRAY WITH DEBRIS AND TRANSPORTED TO THE PSC CAGE TO BE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. UTILIZING THE DMP PROCEDURES OF THE WASTE DISPOSAL FLOW CHART TO BEGIN PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2022090098
item.description:
Report X-2022090098

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-02
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWILIGHT SORT HAD A LEAKER CALLED IN BY A INBOUND SUPERVISOR WHO DISCOVEREND A LEAKING HAZMAT INSIDE OF A TRAILER. THE SUPERVISOR IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED THE PSC TO TELL A DESIGNATED RESPONDER OF THE PACKAGE. THE SINGLE PACKAGE WAS BEARING AN CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL ON IT AND LIQUID WAS SEEN COMING OUT OF THE CORNERS OF THE PACKAGE. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED TO THAT LOCATION AS SOON AS POSSIBLE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND WEARING FULL PPE. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER THEN USED THE REVISED JANUARY 2022 DECISION TREE AND TURN TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSER SHEET. THE DESIGNATED ERSPONDER READ THE ENTIRE RESPONSE SHEET AND REIEWED THE HAZARDS, PPE REQUIRED, RESPONSE ACTION STEPS, AND DECONTAMINATION SECTIONS. HAD AN INITAL PH READING OF 4 AND THEN USED SODIUM BICARBONATE TO NUETRALIZE THE SUBSTANCE. ONCE NUETRAL THEN THE RESPONSER SOLIDIFED THE SUBSTANCE WITH ZEP ZORBENT (MATERIALS USED TO CLEAN UP). THE PACKAGE AND MATERIALS WERE CONTAINERIZED ONCE THE AREA WAS DECONTAMINATED ALL BROUGHT BACK TO THE PSC.

item.title: Report E-2022090533
item.description:
Report E-2022090533

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-29
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0724 ET, XPO terminal XLA in La Salle, IL, reported a spill/leak that occurred inside trailer #4638285 at approximately 0700 ET. The spill consisted of 1 or more 773 pound steel cylinders of argon refrigerated liquid, which was discovered by a dock worker as they heard a "hissing" sound coming from the trailer. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct a site assessment and cleanup. At 1042 ET, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite. Hepaco observed a cylinder of Argon that had been overfilled or became overpressurized due to ambient temperature change. Once the unit reached 350 PSI, the safety relief valve allows the Argon to escape and reduce pressure in the vessel. However, the relief unit is spring operated and once the unit froze, the valve was stuck in the open position. ERTS contacted the shipper and they confirmed this was a common occurrence and advised that if necessary, leave the unit outside and open the vent line and release the material. Hepaco ultimately applied warm water to the ice that had formed which allowed the relief valve to close and stop releasing. ERTS asked Hepaco to check the pressure on the other two cylinders of Argon in this shipment. Hepaco reported that they were close to 350 PSI and agreed to release some of the pressure so all three units could ship on without further incident. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report X-2022090397
item.description:
Report X-2022090397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-15
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2022090397 SequenceEvent: Bucket arrived to our station covered in stains of dried pinkish liquid similar to the liquid inside the pail. Due to this pail not being full completely, it's possible the leak inside the trailer came from this pail. DescribePack: The bucket is covered in dried pink liquid stains that has made this pail too unsafe to ship. Which is what alerted us to keep this pail off to the side for inspection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pail has been placed on a absorbent pad to catch any fallen dried liquid, and other dried liquid that came off was swept and kept in a large hazmat bag. 2 X-2022090398 -SequenceEvent: Bucket was unloaded and found to have several dried pinkish hazardous material liquid stains on it. Bucket was removed and placed in damaged hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: The body of the bucket is covered in stains of dried pink hazmat liquid. Due to this bucket being less full than the others, the leak during prep for shipment may have stemmed from this bucket. The metal handle is also covered in dried hazmat liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was placed on a absorbent pad to catch any fallen dried liquid, and the remaining dried liquid that did fall during relocation was swept and placed in a large hazmat bag.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Loaded 20" container, CMAU 325993, containing totes was discovered to be releasing product. Upon further investigation the product was confirmed to be acetic acid (80% Solution). It was evident that an acid reaction had occurred once end-gate was opened. All totes were unloaded where it was found that (1) tote had a cracked valve causing the release.

  • Description: On August 31, 2022, one (1) 30-drum of Sulphuric Acid was crushed during transit and released approximately 0.25 cups of Sulphuric Acid to the concrete dock. R+L Carriers retained CUra Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Enviroserve (ES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ES personnel noted no free standing product upon arrival, then drummed the damaged container into one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

  • Description: On August 10, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Hexane (UN1208) was punctured during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the concrete loading dock. HCE personnel overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-10
  • City: FRANKLIN PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2022, two (2) 55-gallon drums of paint (contains UN3265) was punctured by a forklift during unloading and released approximately sixty-five (65) gallons of product to the trailer interior and loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hazchem Environmental (HME) to perform the necessary corrective actions. HME stood down and Vortey Coil Finishers (VCF) completed the remediation. VCF drummed the damaged packaging into a new 55-gallon drum and containerized all impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum. VCF then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surfaces.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 3, 2022, one (1) one-gallon container of paint (contains UN1263) was dropped during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and asphalt below trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. HCE utilized absorbents and power washing to remediate the impacted surfaces, then containerized all impacted solid waste in one (1) 15-gallon pail and all liquid waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
